column4: How do I get Ubuntu to try to auto detect what graphics card I'm using? It isn't set up for the right one, and I really have no idea which one I have... Just that it's an old ATI Sapphire.
lspci | grep VGA
what kind of VGA card does it say u have?
00:11.0 VGA compatible controller: ATI Technologies Inc Radeon RV100 QY [Radeon 7000/VE]
i would install the ati driver from the repositories.
er... How do I do that? :(
im not 100% sure but I believe sudo apt-get install xserver-xorg-video-ati
you may need to edit your /etc/X11/xorg.conf and replace the driver line that says "vesa" with "ati"
Ok, I'll try that. It says I have the latest of that thing you asked me to install.
hang on a second
do cat /etc/X11/xorg.conf | grep Driver
is there a line that reads Driver "vesa"?
yeh, under Device, for the Boardname and Driver, both are vesa
you need to change the Driver line to "ati" instead of "vesa"
ok :D Is that it? And JUST the driver line, or boardname as well?
just the driver line, may sure you edit the file using sudo and save it, then restart your X server by ctrl+alt+backspace
whoopsies, I forgot key combos like that don't work over VNC :P
ok, so now what do I do? I restarted
that should be it you should be running the ati driver
i dont remember what your video problem was forgive me im really tired
haha, it's fine :D I just went and changed the monitor and the resolution, all seems to be well. Thanks a bunch! :)
no problem glad to help :)
